This guidance is an ALPHA draft. It is in development and we are still working to ensure that it meets user needs.

Please get in touch with feedback to support the guidance by creating a GitHub Issue or [emailing us](mailto:ASAP@ons.gov.uk).
:::

To get the most out of the template, we strongly recommend that teams identify who will take the three key quality assurance roles of Commissioner, Senior Responsible Owner and Analytical Assurer at the start of the analytical cycle. This is crucial as each of these individuals has a role in ensuring that the analysis you do is fit-for-purpose. You should also identify the members of the analytical team.

## Why the questions matter

<style>
table, th, td {
  border: 1px solid black;
  border-collapse: collapse;
}
</style>

<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
    <th> </th>
    <th> Quality Question</th>
    <th> Why do I need to know the answer to this?</th>

</tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q1</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What question does the analysis try to answer?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>A clear understanding of the analysis question is critical. It enables
  your team to scope out requirements, understand the strengths and limitations
  of the analysis and make sure it is fit for purpose.<br>
    If the question is not clear you risk designing and delivering analysis which
  does not meet user needs.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q2</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Why do you need to answer this analysis question?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Exploring and understanding why you need the analysis, what it is for
  and how it will be used will help you to understand the importance and impact of your
  work, how it supports decision making and how others will use it. It will
  also help you to make sure that all stages of analysis are fit for purpose
  and that the final output correctly answers the question you began with.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q3</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Which organisational priorities does this analysis address?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Knowing how the work aligns with organisational priorities
  helps you to understand how it fits with wider strategic objectives and
  why you need to do the analysis now. It informs the level of
  assurance needed to make sure the work is fit for purpose.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=33 style='height:25.0pt'>
  <td height=33 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:25.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q4</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>If you use a model, is it business critical?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Identifying if the analysis model is business critical helps to define
  the level of assurance needed to ensure it is fit for purpose.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q5</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Who needs the answer to the analysis question?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>If you do not know what your outputs will be used for, you cannot
  be sure they meet user needs. A good understanding of use
  cases and how you prioritise them is essential for making sure that
  all parts of your analysis are fit for purpose.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=167 style='height:125.0pt'>
  <td height=167 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:125.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q6</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Who do you need to consult to make sure you meet the right user
  needs?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Analysis must be well understood by relevant users, or else
  risks scope creep and misspecification. Identify relevant stakeholders and
  users, consult them before designing the analysis, and take account
  of their views and considerations<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
  </span>wherever relevant. Consulting the right stakeholders makes sure that
  you and your users have a shared understanding and vision of 
  the best way to approach answering the question, what the output should look
  like, how well the users understand the process, its quality and limitations,
  and how to tailor the final ouput to best meet user needs.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q7</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>How will you know you have answered the analysis question correctly?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Being clear about the outputs required and the amount of uncertainty
  that is acceptable is essential for ensuring that the final output is
  accurate and reliable and that users and your team have a good understanding
  of limitations and uncertainty. It is also essential when designing
  verification and validation activities that will help you to check the
  robustness of results under a range of plausible assumptions about methods
  and data.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q8</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What is the estimated time and resource required to answer the analysis
  question (in months and FTE)?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Without a clear understanding of time and resource constraints,
  you may overcommit. It is important to push back against unrealistic demands
  if the team is not able to set aside sufficent time to effectively quality
  assure the analysis. The users and commissioner should fully understand and
  accept the associated risks to quality when time and resource pressures are
  unavoidable and will mean that there are unavoidable risks to quality.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q9</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What is the impact if the analysis is not done now?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Understanding why the work needs to happen now will help you to
  prioritise and make sure that limited resources are used for the right
  activities.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q10</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What is the impact if the analysis is not done correctly?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Understanding the possible legal, financial or
  reputational consequences if the analysis is not carried out correctly helps you
   to design a proportionate set of assurance activities. You should also think about
    how these consequences line up with the risk appetite of your organisation and
     consider this when you design your mitigation.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q11</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Name the commissioner, senior responsible owner and analytical assurer of this
  analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Clear lines of accountability strengthen assurance processes and
  make sure that important decisions are signed off by the right people. There
  should be a clear understanding of who is responsible for managing, producing
  and quality assuring the analysis in the team.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q12</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What tools and resources will you use in production? Are they the best for the job?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Before starting an analysis, identify all the skills and
  resources needed to produce the final output in a sustainable and
  reproducible way and to quality assure it at every step. The platform used to
  host the analysis and the software to build and run the analysis should be
  appropriate given uses and risks. For example, producing critical outputs in
  Excel does not comply with best practice and is unlikely to be robust or
  verifiable.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q13</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Do you have the right internal and external resources and
  capability to deliver the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>If the team lacks capability, sufficient resource or time, this
  increases the risk that the analysis will not be fit for purpose or
  sufficiently assured.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q14</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What are the anticipated risks of the analysis? Have you
  discussed these risks with customers and stakeholders?<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>You must identify potential risks and their impact well in
  advance to enable effective mitigation and quicker, confident
  decision-making. It is also important that users understand risks to ensure
  that their expectations and requirements are met. You should document how you
  have identified and are monitoring and mitigating risks.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q15</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Is there a contingency plan prepared if your mitigation plans fail?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Risks that would have a high impact on the analysis but a low
  probability of occurring should still be accounted for, or else risk serious
  harm to the public. Without well designed contingencies we put the public at
  risk.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q16</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Do the data and analysis comply with ethical requirements?<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Analysis must comply with ethics standards to ensure public
  confidence. Data ethics are an essential part of any good analysis. You
  should consider the ethical implications of the analysis and how they feed
  through to use of analysis when you create the workflow and report your
  findings.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q17</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What relevant questions are outside the scope of the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Limitations affect the workings of the analysis and the quality
  of outputs and what can be done with them. By being clear about the
  limitations of the analysis we ensure that we have mitigated or accepted
  them. Limitations must be documented so everybody using the analysis has a
  shared understanding of them.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q18</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>How will you peer review and assure the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Internal audit and peer review are critical for monitoring and
  assuring that the analysis is performed appropriately and its meeting the
  required aims and objectives. The outcomes of the peer review should be
  documented and any relevant actions and recommendations should be addressed
  and taken forward.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6611297 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q19</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Will external experts be involved in development and scrutiny of
  analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6611297 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Your team should commission external specialists to peer review
  or audit the analysis in proportion to the risks around the analysis and its
  use. They should be.able to draw on expertise and experience across
  government and beyond to get feedback, exchange experience and best practices
  to improve the analysis.</td>
  </tr>
</table>

## The questions and the Code of Practice

<TR VALIGN=TOP>
    <th> </th>

    *Trustworthiness (T), Quality (Q), Value (V)</th>

</tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>

<td height=83 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;width:24pt'>Q1</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-left:none;width:241pt'>What
  question does the analysis try to answer?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-left:none;width:276pt'>V1.1
  Statistics producers should maintain and refresh their understanding of the
  use and potential use of the statistics and data. They should consider the
  ways in which the statistics might be used and the nature of the decisions
  that are or could be informed by them.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q2</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Why do you need to answer this analysis question?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V1.1 Statistics producers should maintain and refresh their
  understanding of the use and potential use of the statistics and data. They
  should consider the ways in which the statistics might be used and the nature
  of the decisions that are or could be informed by them.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q3</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Which organisational priorities does this analysis address?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T2.1 The Chief Statistician/Head of Profession for Statistics
  should have sole authority for deciding on methods, standards and procedures,
  and on the content and timing of the release of regular and ad hoc official
  statistics. This should include: determining the need for new official
  statistics, ceasing the release of official statistics, and the development
  of experimental statistics.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=21 style='height:15.5pt'>
  <td height=21 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:15.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q4</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>If you use a model, is it business critical?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3.2 Quality assurance arrangements should be proportionate to
   the nature of the quality issues and the importance of the statistics in
    serving the public good. Statistics producers should be transparent
     about the quality assurance approach taken throughout the preparation
      of the statistics. The risk and impact of quality issues on statistics
       and data should be minimised to an acceptable level for the intended uses.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q5</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Who needs the answer to the analysis question?</td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V1 Users of statistics and data should be at the centre of
  statistical production; their needs should be understood, their views sought
  and acted upon, and their use of statistics supported.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q6</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Who do you need to consult to make sure you meet the right user
  needs?</td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V1<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Users of statistics
  and data should be at the centre of statistical production; their needs
  should be understood, their views sought and acted upon, and their use of
  statistics supported. V1.2 Statistics producers should use appropriate ways
  to increase<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>awareness of the
  statistics and data, communicate effectively with the widest possible
  audience, and support users and potential <br>
    users in identifying relevant statistics to meet their needs.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q7</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>How will you know you have answered the analysis question correctly?</td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Producers of statistics and data should explain clearly how
  they assure themselves that statistics and data are accurate, reliable,
  coherent and timely.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=167 style='height:125.0pt'>
  <td height=167 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:125.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q8</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What is the estimated time and resource required to answer the analysis
  question (in months and FTE)?</td>
  <td class=xl686766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T5 People producing statistics should be appropriately skilled,
  trained and supported in their roles and professional development. T4.3
  Sufficient human, financial and technological resources should be provided to
  deliver statistical services that serve the public good. T3.5 Statistics and
  data should be released on a timely basis and at intervals that meet the
  needs of users as far as practicable. The statistics should be released as
  soon as they are considered ready, under the guidance of the Chie Statistician/Head
  of Profession for Statistics.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q9</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What is the impact if the analysis is not done now?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T2.1 The Chief Statistician/Head of Profession for Statistics
  should have sole authority for deciding on methods, standards and procedures,
  and on the content and timing of the release of regular and ad hoc official
  statistics. This should include: determining the need for new official
  statistics, ceasing the release of official statistics, and the development
  of experimental statistics.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q10</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What is the impact if the analysis is not done 
  correctly?</td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Producers of statistics and data should explain clearly how
  they assure themselves that statistics and data are accurate, reliable,
  coherent and timely.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q11</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Name the commissioner, senior responsible owner and analytical assurer of the
  analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T5.2 The roles and responsibilities of those involved in the
  production of statistics and data should be clearly defined with supporting
  guidance provided to help staff carry out their roles.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q12</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What tools and resources will you use in production? Are they the best for the job?</td>
  <td class=xl686766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T5 People producing statistics should be appropriately skilled,
  trained and supported in their roles and professional development. T5.5 Staff
  should be provided with the time and resources required to develop their
  skills, knowledge and competencies. T4.3 Sufficient human, financial and
  technological resources should be provided to deliver statistical services
  that serve the public good.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q13</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Do you have the right internal and external resources and
  capability to deliver the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Producers of statistics and data should explain clearly how
  they assure themselves that statistics and data are accurate, reliable,
  coherent and timely. T4.3 Sufficient human, financial and technological
  resources should be provided to deliver statistical services that serve the
  public good.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=233 style='height:175.0pt'>
  <td height=233 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:175.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q14</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What are the anticipated risks of the analysis? Have you
  discussed these risks with customers and stakeholders?<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V1<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Users of statistics
  and data should be at the centre of statistical production; their needs
  should be understood, their views sought and acted upon, and their use of
  statistics supported. V4.3 Users should be involved in the ongoing
  development of statistics and data, exploring and testing statistical
  innovations, so that the statistics remain relevant and useful. Q3.2 Quality
  assurance arrangements should be proportionate to the nature of the quality
  issues and the importance of the statistics in serving the public good.
  Statistics producers should be transparent about the quality assurance
  approach taken throughout the preparation of the statistics. The risk and
  impact of quality issues on statistics and data should be minimised to an
  acceptable level for the intended uses.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q15</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is there a contingency plan prepared if your 
  mitigation plans fail?</td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T4.5 Organisations should be open about their commitment to
  quality and make clear their approach to quality management. They should
  ensure that the organisational structure and tools are in place to manage
  quality effectively, and promote and adopt appropriate quality standards.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q16</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Do the data and analysis comply with ethical requirements?<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T6 Organisations should look after people’s information securely
  and manage data in ways that are consistent with relevant legislation and
  serve the public good. T1.1 Everyone that works in organisations producing
  official statistics should handle and use statistics and data with honesty
  and integrity, guided by established principles of appropriate behaviour in
  public life.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=167 style='height:125.0pt'>
  <td height=167 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:125.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q17</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What relevant questions are outside the scope of the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q1.6 The causes of limitations in data sources should be
  identified and addressed where possible. Statistics producers should be open
  <br>
    about the extent to which limitations can be overcome and the impact on the
  statistics. Q2.4 Relevant limitations arising from the methods and their
  application, including bias and uncertainty, should be identified and
  explained to users. An indication of their likely scale and the steps taken
  to reduce their impact on the statistics should be included in the explanation.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q18</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>How will you peer review and assure the work?</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Producers of statistics and data should explain clearly how
  they assure themselves that statistics and data are accurate, reliable,
  coherent and timely. T4.6 Independent measures, such as internal and external
  audit, peer review and National Statistics Quality Reviews, should be used to
  evaluate the effectiveness of statistical processes. Statistics producers
  should be open about identified areas for improvement.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl656766 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q19</td>
  <td class=xl656766 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Will external experts be involved in development and scrutiny of
  analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl676766 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Assured quality Producers of statistics and data should
  explain clearly how they assure themselves that statistics and data are
  accurate, reliable, coherent and timely. T4.6 Independent measures, such as
  internal and external audit, peer review and National Statistics Quality
  Reviews, should be used to evaluate the effectiveness of statistical
  processes. Statistics producers should be open about identified areas for
  improvement.</td>
  </tr>
</table>

## Linking the questions to AQuA Roles

  border: 1px solid black;
  border-collapse: collapse;

</style>

<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
    <th> </th>
    <th> Quality Question</th>
    <th> Which AQuA role(s) would normally answer this?</th>
    <th> Why are these AQuA roles involved?</th>

</tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>

<td height=67 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;width:24pt'>Q1</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-left:none;width:241pt'>What
  question does the analysis try to answer?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-left:none;width:137pt'>Commissioner,
  analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-left:none;width:225pt'>The
  commissioner sets out the commission. They 
  work with the analyst team to ensure that everyone has a common understanding of the
  problem.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q2</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Why do we need to answer this analysis question?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst must document the purpose of the analysis and the
  levels of quality and certainty that are needed to meet user requirements.
  The commissioner and analytical assurer make sure the analysis aligns with the
  stated purpose.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q3</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Which organisational priorities does this analysis address?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure that key aspects of
  the problem, scope and complexities, including programme constraints, are
  captured and clearly communicated. They also make sure there is proportionate governance in
  place to support the analysis and its role in the wider project or
  programme<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=183 style='height:137.5pt'>
  <td height=183 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:137.5pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q4</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>If you use a model, is it business critical?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, Senior Responsible Owner</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>Business critical models must be managed appropriately so that the right specialists are
  responsible for developing, using and assuring them.
  Decision-makers need sufficient assurance from an appropriate level in the organisation
  that the model is fit for purpose before using it to inform a decision.
  For business critical analysis and modelling, the commissioner
  should be satisfied with the seniority of the analytical assurer.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q5</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Who needs the answer to the analysis question?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner,analyst,<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
  </span>analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure that the right stakeholders have been
  identified so that the scope and boundaries of the analysis can be
  appropriately explored. The analyst team and analytical assurer should also contribute.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q6</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Who do you need to consult to make sure you meet the right user
  needs?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>Analysts should explore the analysis requirements and scope
  with all relevant stakeholders to make sure a wide range of perspectives are
  sought. The commissioner should be aware and briefed.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q7</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>How will you know you have answered the analysis question correctly?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>During the design and conduct of analysis, the
  commissioner should set out details like the level of precision,
   accuracy and uncertainty that are needed.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q8</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What is the estimated time and resource required to answer this
  analysis question (in months and FTE)?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, senior responsible owner, analyst team</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>During commissioning and scoping, the commissioner and analyst will
  need to make trade-offs between time, resources and quality. They should work together
  to agree and document the right balance across these constraints.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q9</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What is the impact if the analysis is not done now?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6721709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure that there is sufficient
  time and resource for the required level of assurance to be delivered and
  that they understand the risks when time and resource pressures
  are unavoidable</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q10</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What is the impact if the analysis is not done correctly?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure the analyst team understands the
  context for the analysis question. This helps the analyst to understand
  and assess likely risks and determine the right analytical
  and quality assurance response.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q11</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Name the commissioner, senior responsible owner and analytical assurer of this
  analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>During scoping of the analysis, the
  commissioner makes sure there is proportionate
  governance in place to support the analysis and its role in the wider project
  or programme.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q12</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What tools and resources will you use in production? Are they the best for the job?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure that there is enough
  time and resource for the required level of assurance to be delivered. They must be confident that 
  they understand the risks when time and resource pressures are unavoidable.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q13</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Do you have the right internal and external resources and
  capability to deliver the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure that there is enough
  time and resource for the required level of assurance to be delivered. They must be confident that 
  they understand the risks when time and resource pressures are unavoidable.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q14</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What are the anticipated risks of the analysis? Have you
  discussed these risks with customers and stakeholders?<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analytical assurer, commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analystical assurer should challenge and test the understanding
  of the problem. The commissioner and analyst should work with the analytical assurer
  to make sure that all share a common understanding.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=250 style='height:187.5pt'>
  <td height=250 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:187.5pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q15</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is there a contingency plan prepared if your mitigation plans fail?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, Analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6721709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner makes sure that there is enough
  time and resource for the required level of assurance to be delivered. They must be confident that 
  they understand the risks when time and resource pressures are unavoidable.
  If there is a need for urgent action, such as mitigation of
  unacceptable but uncertain risks, the commissioner may ask for
  further analysis. They might also commission extra evidence-gathering in parallel to inform
  the policy response when uncertainty is reduced.
  The analytical assurer must advise the commissioner on
  whether sufficient analytical quality assurance has happened and inform  
  them about any outstanding risks.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q16</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Do the data and analysis comply with ethical requirements?<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, commissioner, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst should make sure that there is appropriate ethical approval
  for the analysis. The commissioner and analytical assurer should be informed.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=150 style='height:112.5pt'>
  <td height=150 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:112.5pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q17</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What relevant questions are outside the scope of the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner and the analyst work together at the scoping stage 
  to get a clear understanding of analytical requirements.
  During scoping, the commissioner makes sure that the right aspects of the problem, scope and
  complexities, including programme constraints, are captured and clearly
  communicated.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q18</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>How will you peer review and assure the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analytical assurer, commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analytical assurer makes sure quality assurance plans for
  the analysis are appropriate for the decision it supports. All analysis
  requires some level of quality assurance. Analyst and commissioner should be involved.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6521709 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q19</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Will external experts be involved in development and scrutiny of
  analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analytical assurer, commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6521709 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analytical assurer should challenge the proposed approach. Check
  that it delivers as intended and meets customer needs. It is good
  practice to engage subject matter experts in this review. Analyst and
  commissioner should be involved.</td>
  </tr>
</table>

## Why the questions matter

<style>
table, th, td {
  border: 1px solid black;
  border-collapse: collapse;
}
</style>

<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
    <th> </th>
    <th> Question</th>
    <th> Why do I need to know the answer to this?</th>
</tr>
<tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
<td height=67 class=xl666956 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;width:24pt'> Q20 </td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=319 style='border-left:none;width:240pt'>Is there a
  simple, plain English description of what the analysis is for and what it
  does?</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=396 style='border-left:none;width:297pt'>Writing a
  plain English description of what the analysis is for and how it works helps
  you make sure that the team and others with no subject or technical expertise
  can understand what the analysis is for and what it does.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl666956 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q21</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Does the analysis have a logic flowchart which explains the
  end-to-end steps in the workflow?</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Setting out a clear summary of the analysis process in a diagram
  helps the team, users and customers to understand at a glance what the
  analysis does, where inputs come from, how they are processed and how it generates
  outputs.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'></span></td>
 </tr>
<tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
<td height=83 class=xl666956 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q22</td>
 <td class=xl666956 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'> When do you expect to start and finish each stage of analysis:
   data collection, processing, quality assurance, analysis and
  dissemination?</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>You should clearly set out the time you need to perform
  each stage of analysis from start to finish. This helps you to
  evaluate if the current balance of the time split across these stages looks
  effective and plan mitigation if the target looks too ambitious.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
</tr>
<tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl666956 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q23</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Does any part of the analysis rely on manual processing? Have
  you considered the cost and benefits of fully automating the process?</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Manual processes are inefficient and vulnerable to manual error.
  A manual process is inherently more risky than a well-designed automated one.
  Analysis with manual steps like copying and pasting data between files,
  manually updating cells in tables, or moving data between software packages
   are hard to assure and carry extra quality risks.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=167 style='height:125.0pt'>
  <td height=167 class=xl666956 width=31 style='height:125.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q24</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>What happens if team members, reviewers or users find a mistake in the analysis? Do you have a clear and efficient process for addressing issues and preventing them from happening again?</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Mistakes happen in analysis. You should have a clear and
  efficient process for reporting, documenting and addressing errors.
   Being open and honest about problems and working together to solve them
    in a supportive way creates an atmosphere of openness
  in the team and is critical for upholding users' trust in your output.
  Teams should take reasonable steps to understand and document how and why
  errors came about and mitigate the risk of them happening again. Your
  mitigation approach should be consistent with your department's revision
  policies.</td>
  <tr height=150 style='height:112.5pt'>
  <td height=150 class=xl666956 width=31 style='height:112.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q25</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=319 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:240pt'>Have you assessed uncertainty?</td>
  <td class=xl666956 width=396 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:297pt'>Consider how uncertainty impacts on all stages of the analysis.
  Think about quantifying and measuring uncertainty as early as possible in scoping.
  Identify and review sources of uncertainty regularly.
  If you delay the assessment of uncertainty until late in the process it is often difficult and
  costly to mitigate the resulting risks. In some cases, you may need to revise the process or
  alter commissioning decisions. If a potential source of
  uncertainty is overlooked at the start, this can limit the usefulness and
  impact of the analysis.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
  </tr>
 </tr>

</table>

<tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
<td height=50 class=xl656956 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;width:24pt'>Q20</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=321 style='border-left:none;width:241pt'>Is there a
  simple description in plain English of what the analysis is for and what it
  does?</td>
  <td class=xl676956 width=368 style='border-left:none;width:276pt'>V3
  Statistics and data should be presented clearly, explained meaningfully and
  provide authoritative insights that serve the public good.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl656956 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q21</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Does the analysis have a logic flowchart which explains the
  end-to-end conceptual steps in the work flow?</td>
  <td class=xl676956 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V3 Statistics and data should be presented clearly, explained
  meaningfully and provide authoritative insights that serve the public good.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl656956 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q22</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>When do you expect to start and finish each stage of analysis:  
  data collection, processing, quality assurance, analysis and
  dissemination?</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T3.5 Statistics and data should be released on a timely basis
  and at intervals that meet the needs of users as far as practicable. The
  statistics should be released as soon as they are considered ready, under the
  guidance of the Chief Statistician/Head of Profession for Statistics. Q3.3
  The quality of the statistics and data, including their accuracy and
  reliability, coherence and comparability, and timeliness<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>and punctuality, should be monitored and
  reported regularly.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl656956 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q23</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Does any part of the analysis rely on manual processing? Have
  you considered the cost and benefits of fully automating the process?</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V4 Statistics producers should be creative and motivated to
  improve statistics and data, recognising the potential to harness
  technological advances for the development of all parts of the production and
  dissemination process. T4.3 Sufficient human, financial and technological
  resources should be provided to deliver statistical services that serve the
  public good.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl656956 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q24</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What happens if team members, reviewers or users find a mistake in the analysis? Do you have a clear and efficient process for addressing issues and preventing them from happening again?</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3.4 Scheduled revisions, or unscheduled corrections that result
  from errors, should be explained alongside the statistics, being clear on
  <br>
    the scale, nature, cause and impact. V5 Statistics and data should be
  published in forms that enable their reuse. Producers should use existing
  data wherever possible and only ask for more where justified.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl656956 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q25</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you assessed uncertainty?</td>
  <td class=xl656956 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q2.4 Relevant limitations arising from the methods and their
  application, including bias and uncertainty, should be identified and
  explained to users. An indication of their likely scale and the steps taken
  to reduce their impact on the statistics should be included in the
  explanation.</td>
  </tr>
</table>

 <td height=100 class=xl6511553 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;width:24pt'>Q20</td>

  simple, plain English description of what the analysis is for and what it

  <td class=xl6511553 width=182 style='border-left:none;width:137pt'>Analyst,
  analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=299 style='border-left:none;width:225pt'>The analyst
  should produce sufficient design documentation. Best practice can include a
  description of the analysis, user requirements, design specification, functional
  specification, data dictionary, and test plan. The analytical assurer should give
  feedback to make sure documentation is fit for purpose.</td>

 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6511553 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q21</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Does the analysis have a logic flowchart which explains the
  end-to-end steps in the workflow?</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst
  should produce sufficient design documentation. Best practice can include a
   description of the analysis, user requirements, design specification, functional
  specification, data dictionary, and test plan. The analytical assurer should give
  feedback to make sure documentation is fit for purpose.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl6511553 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q22</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>When do you expect to start and finish each stage of analysis: 
  data collection, processing, quality assurance, analysis and
  dissemination?</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst and commissioner should work together during scoping
  to set out and agree trade-offs between time, resources and quality and
   establish the optimal balance of these constraints.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6511553 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q23</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Does any part of the analysis rely on manual processing? Have
  you considered the cost and benefits of fully automating the process?</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6711553 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst should use a risk-based approach to understand the
  areas of greatest potential error and focus assurance efforts on these areas.
  The analyst should brief the commissioner so they understand the impact of
   any reduction in the thoroughness of analytical quality assurance activities.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
  <td height=83 class=xl6511553 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q24</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>What happens if team members, reviewers or users find a mistake in the analysis? Do you have a clear and efficient process for addressing issues and preventing them from happening again?</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6711553 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst should use a risk-based approach to highlight the
  areas of greatest potential error and focus assurance efforts on these areas.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=200 style='height:150.0pt'>
  <td height=200 class=xl6511553 width=31 style='height:150.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q25</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you assessed uncertainty?</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6511553 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>Commissioners should expect and require information about
  uncertainty from analysts. They should challenge them when it is absent, inadequate
  or ambiguous. Commissioners may have identified sources of uncertainty 
  as part of their wider considerations and should share them with the analyst.
  If the commissioner can explain in advance the impact on decision-making of different degrees
  of uncertainty, this can help the analyst to design and carry out the analysis at a
  proportionate level.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>

  </tr>
</table>
