 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>

<td height=83 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:62.5pt;width:24pt'>Q52</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-left:none;width:241pt'>Can you
  give a clear account of what can and cannot be inferred from the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-left:none;width:276pt'>Q2.4
  Relevant limitations arising from the methods and their application,
  including bias and uncertainty, should be identified and explained to users.
  An indication of their likely scale and the steps taken to reduce their
  impact on the statistics should be included in the explanation.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=167 style='height:125.0pt'>
  <td height=167 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:125.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q53</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you assessed the limitations of the data and analysis
  and set out how they affect the quality and use of the outputs?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Producers of statistics and data should explain clearly how
  they assure themselves that statistics and data are accurate, reliable,
  coherent and timely. Q1.5 Potential bias, uncertainty and possible distortive
  effects in the source data should be identified and the extent of any impact
  on the statistics should be clearly reported. Q3.1 Statistics should be
  produced to a level of quality that meets users’ needs. The strengths and
  limitations of the statistics and data should be considered in relation to
  different uses, and clearly explained alongside the statistics.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=50 style='height:37.5pt'>
  <td height=50 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:37.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q54</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you sense checked outputs with user groups and
  stakeholders?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q3 Producers of statistics and data should explain clearly how
  they assure themselves that statistics and data are accurate, reliable,
  coherent and timely.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q55</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is uncertainty about data quality, assumptions and
  methodology clearly communicated to users?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q1.5 Potential bias, uncertainty and possible distortive effects
  in the source data should be identified and the extent of any impact on the
  statistics should be clearly reported. Q2.4 Relevant limitations arising from
  the methods and their application, including bias and uncertainty, should be
  identified and explained to users. An indication of their likely scale and
  the steps taken to reduce their impact on the statistics should be included
  in the explanation.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q56</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Are the implications of unquantified uncertainties communicated
  to users?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>Q2.4 Relevant limitations arising from the methods and their
  application, including bias and uncertainty, should be identified and
  explained to users. An indication of their likely scale and the steps taken
  to reduce their impact on the statistics should be included in the
  explanation. Q3.3 The extent and nature of any uncertainty in the estimates
  should be clearly explained.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=67 style='height:50.0pt'>
  <td height=67 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q57</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is documentation including technical guides and code repositories publicly
  available?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V2 Statistics and data should be equally available to all, not
  given to some people before others. They should be published at a sufficient
  level of detail and remain publicly available.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q58</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Does the technical guide and documentation explain how to run the analysis to obtain
  valid outputs?</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V2 Statistics and data should be equally available to all, not
  given to some people before others. They should be published at a sufficient
  level of detail and remain publicly available. V3 Statistics and data should
  be presented<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>clearly, explained
  meaningfully and provide authoritative insights that serve the public good.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=117 style='height:87.5pt'>
  <td height=117 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:87.5pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q59</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you fully documented the analysis code to comply with good practice?</td>
  <td class=xl675210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>T4.4 Good business practices should be maintained in the use of
  resources. Where appropriate, statistics producers should take opportunities
  to share resources and collaborate to achieve common goals and produce
  coherent statistics. Q2.1 Methods and processes should be based on national
  or international good practice, scientific principles, or established
  professional consensus.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=333 style='height:250.0pt'>
  <td height=333 class=xl655210 width=31 style='height:250.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q60</td>
  <td class=xl655210 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Are users able to feed back on the suitability of outputs?</td>
  <td class=xl675210 width=368 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:276pt'>V1 Users of statistics and data should be at the centre of
  statistical production; their needs should be understood, their views sought
  and acted upon, and their use of statistics supported. V1.4 Statistics
  producers should engage publicly through a variety of means that are
  appropriate to the needs of different audiences and proportionate to the
  potential of the statistics to serve the public good. An open dialogue should
  be maintained using proactive formal and informal engagement to listen to the
  views of new and established contacts. Statistics producers should undertake
  public engagement collaboratively wherever possible, working in partnership
  with policy makers and other statistics producers to obtain the views of
  stakeholders. V1.5 The views received from users, potential users and other
  stakeholders should be addressed, where practicable. Statistics producers
  should consider whether to produce new statistics to meet identified
  information gaps. Feedback should be provided to them about how their needs
  can and cannot be met, being transparent about reasons for the decisions made and any constraints.</td>
 </tr>
  </tr>
</table>

## Linking the questions to AQuA roles

<style>
table, th, td {
  border: 1px solid black;
  border-collapse: collapse;
}
</style>

<table width="100%" border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<TR VALIGN=TOP>
    <th> </th>
    <th> Quality Question</th>
    <th> Which AQuA role(s) would normally answer this?</th>
    <th> Why are these AQuA roles involved?</th>
</tr>
 <tr height=83 style='height:62.5pt'>
<td height=67 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:50.0pt;width:24pt'>Q52</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-left:none;width:241pt'>Can you
  give a clear account of what can and cannot be inferred from the analysis?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-left:none;width:137pt'>Commissioner, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=299 style='border-left:none;width:225pt'>During the
  delivery phase, the commissioner receives the results of the analysis
  and decides whether it meets their needs. The analyst provides sufficient information
  to support the commissioner to make an informed decision.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q53</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you assessed the limitations of the data and analysis
  and set out how they affect the quality and use of the outputs?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Commissioner, analytical assurer, analyst</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The commissioner must be confident in the quality of the outputs.
  They should understand the strengths, limitations and context of the analysis so
  that the results are correctly interpreted. Analytical assurer sign-off
  provides confidence that analysis risks, limitations and major assumptions
  are understood by the users of the analysis. Analysts make sure that the
  commissioner and analytical assurer have the evidence they need.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=217 style='height:162.5pt'>
  <td height=217 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:162.5pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q54</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you sense checked outputs with user groups and
  stakeholders?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6731542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst and analytical assurer should enable and encourage peer review.
  Peer reviews provide useful critical challenge about the analytical
  approach, application of methods and interpretation of the analysis.
  Verification and peer review of work should be done by analysts who had no involvement
  in the work <br> so their views are independent.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=133 style='height:100.0pt'>
  <td height=133 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:100.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q55</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is uncertainty about data quality, assumptions and
  methodology clearly communicated to users?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst must determine and communicate the uncertainty
  associated with the analysis so the commissioner can
  make informed decisions. The commissioner
  should ensure that an assessment of uncertainty has been provided and that
  the implications of uncertainty are understood.<span
  style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=150 style='height:112.5pt'>
  <td height=150 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:112.5pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q56</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Are the implications of unquantified uncertainties communicated
  to users?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, commissioner</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>If uncertainty is too complex to quantify,
  even approximately, the analysts should explain this so the commissioner
  can take this into account. In communicating analysis results to
  decision-makers and stakeholders, the commissioner should be open about the
  existence of deep uncertainties whose impact cannot be assessed, and
  explain how they are managed in the analysis.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q57</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is documentation including technical guides and code repositories publicly
  available?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6731542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst must produce appropriate design documentation. Best practice includes
  maintaining a record of the analysis workflow in a technical report,
  including a concept of analysis, user requirements, design specification,
  functional specification, data dictionary, and test plan. Code should be properly documented.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=100 style='height:75.0pt'>
  <td height=100 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:75.0pt;border-top:none;
  width:24pt'>Q58</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Does the technical guide and documentation explain how to run the analysis to obtain
  valid outputs?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6731542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>The analyst must produce appropriate documentation. Best practice includes
  maintaining a record of the work that has been done in a technical report,
  including a full description of the analysis, user requirements, design specification,
  functional specification, data dictionary, and test plan. The analytical assurer makes sure
  that the documentation is fit for purpose.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=168 style='height:126.0pt'>
  <td height=168 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:126.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q59</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Have you fully documented the analysis code to comply with good practice?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, analytical assurer</td>
  <td class=xl6931542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>Analysts should develop and maintain analysis code in line with best practice.
  Code must comply with relevant policies and standards.</td>
 </tr>
 <tr height=167 style='height:125.0pt'>
  <td height=167 class=xl6531542 width=31 style='height:125.0pt;border-top:
  none;width:24pt'>Q60</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=321 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:241pt'>Is there a clear feedback mechanism so users can report back on the suitability of outputs?</td>
  <td class=xl6531542 width=182 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:137pt'>Analyst, senior responsible owner</td>
  <td class=xl6731542 width=299 style='border-top:none;border-left:none;
  width:225pt'>You can assess the usefulness of the analysis by
  getting feedback from users, stakeholders and other experts. Quality
  analysis should be free of prejudice or bias.
  The SRO and analysts should check that the analysis follows the
  principles of RIGOUR (Repeatable, Independent, Grounded in reality,
  Objective, Uncertainty-managed, Robust)</td>
  </tr>
</table>
:::
